DeregistrationReasonOtherText: We no longer operate this facility,as it's been sold to another organization

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Policy

The owners, management and employees of Treynor Ag are committed to the preventioin of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental releaseshould occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Pottawattimie County LEPC and/or any other authorities, to mitigatew and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

Facility Information

The primary activity at the facility is the distributiopn of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

Worst Case Release Scenario and the Alternate release Scenario

An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our hazard Assetment and the information is in our risk management Program.

Accidental release Prevetnion Program

The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111  Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia,  and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  The OSHA standard is refferred to in this RMP Registration Firm,  see section 8.3(b).

5 Year History

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility,  nor to our knowledge has there been any accidental releases resulting in off site deaths, injuries property damage,  or environmental damage.

Emergency Action plan

the facility has:     a written emergency plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38
           
                           Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right -to-know information as 
required under the SARA Title III EPCPA)

If a large release of anhydrous ammonina takes place at thie facilitym the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911.  and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our Emergency Actiob Plan.

Planned Chnages to Improve safety

                            Saefty improvemtn is an on-going process at this facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of treynor Ag Supply.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
